--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Robert Wenner" <robert.wenner@g...> wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> > i am trying to run a junit test that is used to test the method 
> > Math.round() in java.lang.Math.
> Why do you want to test java.lang code?
> Do you work with Sun?

You can also write "tests" to make your understanding of a
feature/API/etc. explicit.  If you want to remind yourself of the
actual behavior of some boundary cases, then a set of tests might be
exactly the right thing to do.  Mike Clark even says that he learned
Ruby by using tests.  http://www.clarkware.com/cgi/blosxom/2005/03/18#RLT1

-Rob
